Tom Coraghessan Boyle  is an American novelist and short story writer. Since the mid-1970s, he has published fourteen novels and more than 100 short stories. He won the PEN/Faulkner award in 1988, for his third novel, World's End, which recounts 300 years in upstate New York.
He is a Distinguished Professor of English at the University of Southern California.
